title: CLONE - EBIS Link PostgreSQL: Update EBIS Couchbase Integrations
custom_preconds: EBIS directly integrates with Couchbase and this code will need to be updated to point to Postgres.  (this a placeholder ticket)Currently identified classes are:TrainerAgentBatchDaoImplEbisLinkAwardApiDaoImplEbisLinkAddCApiDaoImplEbisLinkAddDApiDaoImplEbisLinkMncApiDaoImplPersonProfileBatchDaoImplEbisLinkTxApiDaoImpl

title: As a user I want the Quick Search results box to stay open when no results are returned
custom_preconds: Wireframe: [+https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=advanced_search_via_quick_search+|https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=advanced_search_via_quick_search]AC:* The search results box stays open even when no results are returned. Right now it closes by default, making the Advanced Search link inaccessible. * Display the text ‰ÛÏNo results found‰Û� if no results are returned

title: EBISII-18888 - Tender tx created via Central Tender process should cache in Link
custom_preconds: GIVEN the entire central tender workflow has been completed for the season (Tender sheets submitted, verified for all clubs, utility frozen)
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks "Finalize" button
AND Tender transactions are created
custom_expected:
THEN these tender transactions should be available in link for users with valid perms by hitting:
https://ebislinkstg.mlb.com/clubs/4hSWpbwprbmS5AQ6/tx/txId
https://ebislinkstg.mlb.com/clubs/4hSWpbwprbmS5AQ6/tx/playerId
https://ebislinkstg.mlb.com/clubs/4hSWpbwprbmS5AQ6/tx/all
https://ebislinkstg.mlb.com/clubs/4hSWpbwprbmS5AQ6/tx/updated
AND all clubs with link Tx perm should be able to view all records once destaged
AND link response should work as described here:
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3789723/Club+Feed+Requirements+Transactions+-+Tender

title: Player name missing from Rule 5 reports
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the rule 5 draft has been run
AND the post draft batch has been run
custom_steps:
WHEN user runs the following reports:
Players Selected in (Year) Draft
Press Release Selection List
custom_expected:
THEN all players selected players should display on the reports
(see linked jira for details)

title: As a CEP Auditor, I was to see a Fraud Flag on the Payment History section of the CEP tab

title: As a CEP Auditor, I want to see a new Auditor Comments box in the CEP Payment History section
custom_preconds: Wire: https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=cepAC: - Users with the new CEP Auditor Role will see a new Auditor Comments box in the Payment History section of the CEP tab - Users without the new role won't see comment box

custom_preconds: Wire: https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=cepAC: - Users with the new CEP Auditor role will see a new Audit Date column - Users without the new role will not see the column - The new column will be a date picker - Each row will be blank by default

title: PERMISSIONS: CEP Tracking
custom_preconds: There will be a new role that governs access to the CEP Tracking tab and the new features added to the CEP Payment HistoryRole: CEP AuditorsGroup: ebis-util-cep-tracking

title: As a CEP Admin User, I want to see the Flag Weights table widget on the CEP Tracking tab
custom_preconds: Wire: [https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=analysis|https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=analysis]Data Discovery:AC:* On the CEP Tracking tab, there will be a ‰ÛÏFlag Weights‰Û� section* Inside this section will be a table of values** The table will match the provided wire** These values will be used in calculations done by the Analysis widget (later story)** The values in the table will be editable at all times* This section will be collapsed by defaultNOTE: Adding and Deleting saved templates will come in a later story

title: As a CEP Admin User, I want to see a new CEP Tracking tab under the CSP/CEP Left Nav
custom_preconds: AC:* Users with the CEP Auditor Role will see a new CEP Tracking tab under the CSP/CEP dashboard on the left nav* Clicking this will load the CEP Tracking tab* Users without the role will not see the CEP Tracking as an option anywhere and will not be able to navigate to it

title: As a CEP Admin User, I want to require users to attach invoices to CEP Invoices
custom_preconds: Wire:  [https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=invoice_1|https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=invoice_1]AC:* There will be a new Attachments section added to CEP invoices, as depicted in the wire* Attachments will be required to save* Label options for the attachments will be:** Tuition/Fees** Books/Supplies** Living Expenses** Other Covered Expenses* If ‰ÛÏOther Covered Expenses‰Û� is selected as the label, comments will be required for the file** The bubble icon will become red if no comments have been added** Once comments are added, the bubble will turn blue

title: As a CEP Auditor, I want to save changes to a Flag Weight template
custom_preconds: Wire: https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=save_a_flag_weight_templateAC: - When viewing a template, there will be a "save" hyperlink - Users will be able to save changes to all templates, including the default - Clicking the hyperlink will commit the changes  -- A blue Template Saved message will be displayed - Changes will only committed to the template currently being viewed

title: As a CEP Auditor, I want to delete a Flag Weight template
custom_preconds: Wire: https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=delete_a_flag_weight_templateAC: - When viewing a custom template, there will be a "delete" hyperlink - The "delete" hyperlink will not be active when viewing the default template - Clicking the hyperlink will launch a modal, as depicted in the wire - The modal will have Delete and Cancel buttons - Clicking delete will prompt the user to confirm their actions  -- If they confirm, the template will be deleted from the system, the modal will be dismissed, and the default template will be loaded  -- If they don't confirm, the modal will be dismissed - Clicking cancel will dismiss the modal

title: As a CEP Auditor, I want to create a new Flag Weight template
custom_preconds: Wire: https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=new_flag_weight_templateAC: - There will be a "new" hyperlink in the Flag Weight section as depicted in the wire - Clicking "new" will launch a modal containing all the field labels, but no values - The modal will also have a space for the user to enter a name for the new template - The modal will have Save and Cancel buttons - Clicking Save will commit the changes and dismiss the modal  -- A blue Template Saved message will be displayed - Clicking Cancel will prompt the user to confirm their action  -- If they confirm, the modal will be dismissed and nothing will be committed  -- If they don't confirm, they'll be returned to the modal

title: As a CEP Auditor, I want to export the CEP Analysis table
custom_preconds: Wire: [https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=analysis|https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=analysis]AC:* There will be an export button displayed at the bottom of the CEP Analysis section* The button will only be visible if there are players loaded into the table* Clicking Export will export the player population and correct values into an excel file for the user* The columns, order, and formatting will all match what is displayed on the UI

title: As a CEP Auditor, I want to load players on the CEP Analysis
custom_preconds: Wire:  https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=analysisAC: - When loading the CEP Track dashboard, the CEP Analysis section will load without a population of players populated - There will be a "Load / Recalc" button displayed next to the filters - When the user clicks the button, the utility will load a player population based on the filters and values entered into the flag weight section - If the user does not adjust the filters before clicking the button, the utility will return a population based on the filter defaults - If there is already a population of players displayed and the user clicks the button, the utility will refresh the population of players based on the filters and recalc the values displayed based on the variables displayed in the flag weight section

title: As a CEP Auditor, I want clicking the Score column to open a popover
custom_preconds: Wire:  https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=analysisData Discovery:AC: - The score column will be a hyperlink - Clicking the hyperlink will launch a popover as depicted in the wire - The popover will display the rows and values depicted for the appropriate players

title: As a CEP Admin User, I want to see the CEP Analysis table
custom_preconds: Wire:  [https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=analysis|https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=analysis]Data Discovery:AC:* There will be a table within the CEP Analysis section of the CEP Tracking dashboard* The table  will match the provided wire and data discovery** This includes column order and formatting

title: As a BOC MNC Admin, I want Parent/Guardian to enter their Signing City and State while esigning their MNC
custom_preconds: AC:* If signing location has not been filled out on the UI, the parent/guardian will have the ability to fill out the following fields through the esign process:** City** State** *Note: Country is required on the UI, so it should always be populated* If the information is filled out on the UI, these fields will not be editable through esign* Filling them out once will carry them through the rest of the document* These fields appear on the parental guardian consent pages

title: As a BOC MNC Admin, I want Players to enter their Signing City and State while esigning their MNC
custom_preconds: AC:* If signing location has not been filled out on the UI, the player will have the ability to fill out the following fields through the esign process:** City** State** *Note: Country is required on the UI, so it should always be populated* If the information is filled out on the UI, these fields will not be editable through esign* Filling them out once will carry them through the rest of the document* These fields appear on the Add F, Add G, and Execution of Contract pages

title: As a User, I want to see the esign status modal for a Player Letter from the E-Sign Widgets
custom_preconds: Value:  There is no form to visit for player letters, so there is no place to view the esign status modal.AC: - When clicking the Form Type column, in either the Player E-Signature widget or the Club E-Signature, the esign status modal will be displayed - This will function the same as clicking the E-Sign button on a form that has been sent for e-signature - There will be Cancel E-Signature button and a Cancel button on the modal

title: As a User, I want to Esign an Advance Consent Letter [Spanish]
custom_preconds: Note: The spanish version of player letter is automatically printed when the player's language is set to SpanishAC: - When creating a new Advance Consent Letter [Spanish] from a player profile, there will be an Esign option - The Esign process will follow the flow set up in a prior story - All fields printed on the Letter will be continue to print"  -- Player Name  -- Letter Date  -- Affiliate Name  -- Player Name (under signature line) - The only esignable field will be the players signature  --  It will be required - Player signature date will be captured by the system - Authorized Signatory signature and date will follow the existing club stamping process

title: As a User, I want to Esign an Advance Consent Letter (Free Agent Election Option) [Spanish]
custom_preconds: AC: - When creating a new Advance Consent Letter (Free Agent Election Option) [Spanish] from a player profile, there will be an Esign option - The Esign process will follow the flow set up in a prior story - All fields printed on the Letter will be continue to print"  -- Player Name  -- Letter Date  -- Affiliate Name (x2)  -- Player Name (under signature line) - The only esignable field will be the players signature  -- It will be required - Player signature date will be captured by the system - Authorized Signatory signature and date will follow the existing club stamping process

title: As a User, I want to Esign an Advance Consent Letter (Free Agent Election Option)
custom_preconds: AC: - When creating a new (Free Agent Election Option) from a player profile, there will be an Esign option - The Esign process will follow the flow set up in a prior story - All fields printed on the Letter will be continue to print"  -- Player Name  -- Letter Date  -- Affiliate Name (x2)  -- Player Name (under signature line) - The only esignable field will be the players signature  -- It will be required - Player signature date will be captured by the system - Authorized Signatory signature and date will follow the existing club stamping process

title: As a User, I want to Esign an Advance Consent Letter
custom_preconds: AC: - When creating a new Advance Consent Letter from a player profile, there will be an Esign option - The Esign process will follow the flow set up in a prior story - All fields printed on the Letter will be continue to print"  -- Player Name  -- Letter Date  -- Affiliate Name  -- Player Name (under signature line) - The only esignable field will be the players signature  -- It will be required - Player signature date will be captured by the system - Authorized Signatory signature and date will follow the existing club stamping process

title: As a User, I want to send a player letter for esign
custom_preconds: *Note:* This story is only meant to add the esign flow to player letters.  Subsequent stories will be added to handle individual letters.Wire:https://82lvmf.axshare.com/#p=submit_player_letter_for_e-sigAC: - When creating a new player letter, there will be a radio button for the user to choose between printing and esign - When Print is selected, there will be a Print button available the already existing process may continue, unchanged - When Esign is selected, Authorized Signatory dropdown and a Continue (inactive) button will appear  -- Authorized Signatory will be required and be populated with the Org's authorized signatories - Selecting an Authorized Signatory will activate the Continue button - Clicking Continue will bring the user to the next screen where they are able to select what esign method will be used  -- Users may choose In Person or Email  -- If Email is selected, Email and Phone Number fields will be displayed and prepopulated with the player's primary contact information - Clicking Continue will prompt the user to confirm they wish to Submit for E-Signature - If they confirm, the letter will be sent for esign and the status modal will be displayed

title: As a User, I want to see a new E-Sig Type column on the Player esign widget
custom_preconds: Wire:[https://82lvmf.axshare.com/#p=e-signature_1|https://82lvmf.axshare.com/#p=e-signature_1]AC:* There will be a new ‰ÛÏE-Sig Type‰Û� column added to the Player E-Sign widget, as depicted in the provided wire* Possible values for this column:** In Person** Email* If the line item was sent for In Person esgin, ‰ÛÏIn Person‰Û� will be displayed* If the line item was set for esign via email, ‰ÛÏEmail‰Û� will be displayed

title: As a User, I want to see SFD's sent for esign in the Player's Esign Widget
custom_preconds: AC:* When a SFD is sent to a doctor for esigning, it will appear under the Standard Form of Diagnosis filter in the Player Esign widget* The player's name will be appended with " - MD" to signify the row corresponds to a doctor signature** This is similar to Parent/Guardian signatures work* Once the doctor has completed signing, the SFD will disappear from the Player Esign widget and be displayed in the Club Esign widget

title: As an LRD user I want players added to the saved CBT Payroll as 'COVID Credit' to be included on the Multi Year Payroll Player Details report.
custom_preconds: If a player is added to the saved CBT payroll with the new 'COVID Credit' wage type ([PIVOTAL-611]) then they should display on the CBT version of the Multi Year Player Details report with: ' - COVID Credit' appended to their name and the base wage value will match the value entered on the utilityAC:* Players added as COVID Credits appear on the CBT Payroll Details report* COVID Credit is appended to the player's name* All totals reflect the additions of COVID Credit

title: As an LRD user I want players added to the saved CBT Payroll as 'COVID Credit' to be included on the Payroll Team Details report.
custom_preconds: If a player is added to the saved CBT payroll with the new 'COVID Credit' wage type ([PIVOTAL-611]) then they be included on the CBT version of the Team Details report.  If any team has a player with a COVID Credit there will be a new column which displays the total for that team.  If no team has a covid credit then this column will not be displayed.AC:* There will be a new COVID Credits column on the Payroll - Team Details CBT report when ANY team has a player with a COVID Credit.* Players added as COVID Credits are counted under their teams COVID Credits column (with a negative value)* All totals reflect the additions of the COVID Credit

title: As an LRD User I want there to be a new system value: "CBT Base COVID Credit"
custom_preconds: There will be a new system value added to the system values screen called "CBT Base COVID Credit"If this value is entered for a year:* It will show up as a line item on the CBT version of the Payroll - Player Details report beneath the 'Extended Benefits' line item, the value entered should be negative.* It will show up as a new column on the CBT Version of the Payroll - Team Details report, after the Extended Benefits column* It will show up as a new line item on the CBT Version of the Multi-Year Report - Player details for all years.  Any year without a value will show up with a 0* It will be included in the totals for any year where a value is entered on the CBT Version of the Multi-Year Report - Team DetailsIf this value is NOT entered, the row and column will not appear on their respective reportsAC:* There is a new CBT Base COVID Credit system value which can be entered and saved correctly* If the value is saved, it appears as described above on the Payroll - Player, Team Details reports, Multi-Year Report - Player Details and Team details.* If the value is not saved or is zero then it will not appear on the payroll player detail report* If the value is not saved or is zero then it will not appear on the payroll team detail report - unless there are actual player specific COVID credits entered for the year* If any year in the multi year‰Ûªs 8 year range has a value, a line item will appear on the multi year player details.  In this case, years without a value will display 0* Multi year team details totals will reflect covid credits appropriately* All totals should reflect the addition of the base credit

title: As an LRD user I want players added to the saved CBT Payroll as 'COVID Credit' to display on the player details report.
custom_preconds: If a player is added to the saved CBT payroll with the new 'COVID Credit' wage type ([PIVOTAL-611]) then they should display on the CBT version of the Player Details report with: ' - COVID Credit' appended to their name with the value entered on the payroll report utilityAC:* Players added as COVID Credits appear on the CBT Payroll Details report with the correct value* COVID Credit is appended to the player's name* All totals reflect the additions of COVID Credit

title: As an LRD user I want to be able to add a 'COVID Credit' to a saved CBT Payroll
custom_preconds: On the Major Contracts->Payroll Reports utility the user can add a new player to a saved payroll.  If the payroll type selected is CBT then one of the Wage Type selections will be 'COVID Credit'.Adding a player with this value and saving the payroll should correctly add the row.The value will always be a negative number (but there is nothing enforcing this)AC:* User is able to add a new ‰Û÷COVID Credit‰Ûª row for a player to the CBT Payrolls on the Payroll Report utility

title: The MN minimum salary system values need to be split into two, one for CBT and one for LRD
custom_preconds: The minimum minor league salaries system value used by the payroll calculations needs to be split into two values, one for LRD and the one for CBTThe existing value:Minimum Minor League Salaryshould be changed to:Minimum Minor League Salary LRDAnd a new values should be added called:Minimum Minor League Salary CBTIf only the LRD value is entered, that should be used in the calculations for BOTH CBT and LRD, however if the values are different then the correct value should be used (If neither is used than the default minimum of 52600 is used)This comes into play in the calculations for players like Taylor Jones ([https://ebis.mlb.com/ebisui/#/major-contract/payroll?mjcId=31005102&playerId=370451)|https://ebis.mlb.com/ebisui/#/major-contract/payroll?mjcId=31005102&playerId=370451)] who are signed to an MN split, but are recalled and optioned again.Another example (so far the only other example this year): Jake Woodford (STL)

title: As a User, I want the Maximum Number of Option Give Back Days to Be Configurable in the DB
custom_preconds: Give Back DaysAC:* There will be a new Maximum Number of Option Give Back Days value added to the DB* This value will be easily configurable and will dictate the maximum number of MLS days that can be given back to a player eligible for give back days* This will come into play if a give back days are calculated using Adjusted MLS* For example, if a player is optioned for 19 days, and give back days are calculated using Adjusted MLS, that player would be given back 53 days of MLS.  This new value would enable us to cap the number of days a player may earn.

title: As a User, I want a DB Flag to determine whether Option Give Back Days are calculated using Adjusted or Actual MLS
custom_preconds: AC: - There will be a new DB flag that can be used to drive whether Option Give Back Days are calculated using Actual or Adjusted MLS - If the flag is set to Actual, Option Give Back Days are given back at a rate of 1 day of MLS for every Option Day - If the flag is set to Adjusted, the number of Option Give Back Days is determined using the MLS multiplier (this year its 2.776 days per day)

title: As a User, I want the Max Days amount for Option Give Back Days calc to be configurable
custom_preconds: Days on OptionAC:* The threshold for Option Give Back days will be a new easily configurable DB value* Currently, if a player's total number of option days in a season is <= 19, the player will be given 1 day of MLS for each of those days* The new DB value will allow the 19 days to be configurable* The batch will work using the new constant
